channel.title: RuneEmu [Public Version 1.0.0]
channel.description:
[b]About[/b]
This source contains the following additions to the ScapeEmulator source released by Graham and his brother:
[ul][li]Plugin System[/li] [li]NPC Behaviors[/li] [li]Improved Interfaces[/li] [li]Following[/li] [li]Doors and Gates[/li][/ul]
The condition of each release is that it will not have any major content added to it since this is an ongoing project. I feel like if you are given a backbone, you can easily do the rest. I will not include any major skill plugins with the release and will withhold some of my research that I find critical to creating a unique server.
[b]Media[/b]
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7aKAWcqSsz8
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XSUIxUflTPw
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Gk-j0gLKW20
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=smH7FmEsaKE
[b]How to run?[/b]
Run either the run.sh for unix machines or run.bat for windows machines. A client download isn't necessary, point your browser at 127.0.0.1/index_gl.html or 127.0.0.1:8080/index_gl.html or just 127.0.0.1 or 127.0.0.1:8080
HD I believe will not work on Unix machines. It hasn't worked on my Unix machine yet.
[b]Download[/b]
[url=https://mega.co.nz/#!N8EF3LxJ!dnkdxncCBfU4GRCgb7TZZRNQjotpXpFdY3g-ols3pzk]link[/url]
[b]Credits[/b]
Graham and his Brother Evelus Team

item.title: RuneEmu [Public Version 1.0.0]
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

[quote=“Anval, post:13, topic:529526”][quote author=sinisoul link=topic=648281.msg4360911#msg4360911 date=1378698932]

Was character saving implemented? MySQL, or via a file? I remember saving/character creation wasn’t done in ScapeEmu, iirc

Its done via SQL if you enable it that way
[/quote]

Is there music in-game? Or is that just in the background of the videos?[/quote]

Music areas hadn’t been added in yet, so no.

Read full topic

item.title: RuneEmu [Public Version 1.0.0]
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

[quote=“Anval, post:7, topic:529526”][quote author=sinisoul link=topic=648281.msg4360752#msg4360752 date=1378681590]

Is it possible that you guys make guides, to show ‘noobs’ like me in this stuff, how to get it perfectly working

Greetings Gomez

There isn’t much to it but a lot of it is scripting via Ruby which may be tough for people starting out.
[/quote]

Yes, but once you get familiar with Ruby, it’s very easy.[/quote]

Oh yes. It makes development a lot less cluttered and fun.

Read full topic

@sinisoul wrote:

About

This source contains the following additions to the ScapeEmulator source released by Graham and his brother:

[ul][li]Plugin System[/li]
[li]NPC Behaviors[/li]
[li]Improved Interfaces[/li]
[li]Following[/li]
[li]Doors and Gates[/li][/ul]

The condition of each release is that it will not have any major content added to it since this is an ongoing project. I feel like if you are given a backbone, you can easily do the rest. I will not include any major skill plugins with the release and will withhold some of my research that I find critical to creating a unique server.

Media

How to run?

Run either the run.sh for unix machines or run.bat for windows machines. A client download isn’t necessary, point your browser at 127.0.0.1/index_gl.html or 127.0.0.1:8080/index_gl.html or just 127.0.0.1 or 127.0.0.1:8080

HD I believe will not work on Unix machines. It hasn’t worked on my Unix machine yet.

link
